referralDetails.reason: Acute liver injury with jaundice requiring specialist evaluation

clinicalContext.text: 46-year-old male construction worker presenting with acute onset jaundice and severe pruritus. Recent history of dental infection treated with Augmentin, followed by excessive acetaminophen use for pain management.

concerningFeatures.text: Marked elevation in liver enzymes (ALT >600 U/L)

actionsTaken.text: Ordered comprehensive liver panel and CBC
Advised patient to avoid alcohol and unnecessary medications

questionsForSpecialist.text: Is this drug-induced liver injury (DILI) from Augmentin or acetaminophen?
What is the prognosis and risk of progression?

attachedDocuments.title: Urgent Care Referral Letter
attachedDocuments.source: Dr. Richard Jenkins, Midtown Primary Care
